bio1: Shatilla Prayer is a Graphic Designer and Web Developer originally from Chicago, IL. Shatilla Prayer has earned their Bachelors of Science Degree in Graphic Design from UNLV. Shatilla has spent most of their undergraduate career working on campus assisting UNLV Online Education with developing interactive courses for online students. Shatilla Prayer has years of experience developing eLearning content and developing interactive user applications for UNLV.
bio2: As Shatilla explored their undergraduate degree, they has taken many courses in Graphic Design, Business, Computer Science, Fine Arts, and Sciences. This has given her many diverse career options for the future. Being open to various areas of study makes Shatilla is a very versatile designer and developer.
bio3: Overall, Shatilla Prayer loves to develop new user experiences that apply high-level learning and development of new ideas. In the future, Shatilla Prayer plans to pursue graduate studies to learn more about Computer Science and Human-Computer Interaction.

latest.title: Interactive Web Applications
latest.desc: You can view my latest work here. I have created many front-end applications that help assist students with learning online. Many of the students have been able to utilize my interactives in real life scenarios. These interactives provide skills and incorporate learning in a fun and productive way.

interactives.name: Operation Interactive (WIP)
interactives.description: The UNLV College of Health Sciences wanted to create an interactive way to engage students in learning about Anatomy and Physiology. I created a responsive interactive that assists students in learning the parts of the Human Body. This application is still in progress and here is a simple demo.

picture.name: operation-pic.png
picture.desc: Application Design High-fidelity. Work in Progress.

picture.name: op4.png
picture.desc: Help Menu slidshow. This will be implemented later.

picture.name: op6.png
picture.desc: This page shows the interface when student gets answer correct.

interactives.name: Healthcare Learning App
interactives.description: The Healthcare Learning company is created to help people learn life-saving skills in a simple and quick amount of time. This project was inspired by my interest in Graphic Design and eLearning. I created a concept and prototype for my undergraduate thesis around the idea of pairing the two disciplines together to create an easy and intuitive user interface. I have included research and data that supports my reasoning behind the design and branding in the pdf document. I also tested this prototype for many medical students at UNLV, and they were interested in utilizing this application for their coursework in school.

picture.name: health.jpg
picture.desc: Research about the design of Healthcare Learning. View the pdf for more info.

picture.name: healthcare2.png
picture.desc: Understanding Blood Pressure module in the course.

interactives.name: World Map (Past and Present)
interactives.description: The University of Nevada, Las Vegas Library and Department of English wanted an interactive map of the world that showcased literature from cultures of the past and present. I created the world map user interface and developed this project with AngularJS. Thousands of English literature students at UNLV utilize my application as a resource for their upper-level English courses.

interactives.name: Activity Planner
interactives.description: The UNLV Department of Urban and Environmental Studies wanted to create a planner that helped students with their semester plans. The planner lets students choose their assignments based on the topic and receive a PDF copy of their semester plan at the touch of a button. I created this application using Angular and developed the design, assets, and user interface.

picture.name: planner.jpg
picture.desc: Responsive Design and Dynamic Data Application.

picture.name: planner1.png
picture.desc: Assignment Page with two tasks to choose from.

picture.name: planner2.png
picture.desc: Assignment Page with 3 Tasks to choose from.

interactives.name: Blood Pressure and Radial Pulse
interactives.description: The UNLV Department of Sciences wanted to create a completely online Biology lab. I created a Blood Pressure simulation application. I researched how to take blood pressure and created the UI and functionality for the project. This project was created using JavaScript and incorporates simple interactive methodologies. This project has helped over thousands of online students to understand the mechanisms of taking blood pressure and preparing them for their studies in the Health Science profession.

interactives.name: Binar Tesla Prototype
interactives.description: BINAR Technologies is a technical company that creates multimedia systems for cars. I created a working prototype of a multimedia system for a Tesla based on a demographic of tech-savvy individuals. I researched and interviewed users on their needs and wants of a multi-media system. I followed UX principles of design by incorporating these techniques for an intuitive experience. This system is also built for safety and a streamlined experience. I developed the branding, design, and development of the prototype. It was developed in AngularJS. Please take a look at the research of the project.

picture.name: binar1.jpg
picture.desc: Binar Application displayed in Tesla Dashboard.

interactives.name: Monster Genetics
interactives.description: For all the Biology lovers! The UNLV College of Sciences wanted to teach students about Genetics through a fun experience. I created an application that shows how genotypes and phenotypes work in the field of Genetics. The UI and design was created by me. I also developed this application with HTML5 and JavaScript. At the end, students receive a PDF print out to keep for their own resource.

picture.name: monster3.png
picture.desc: Customizable Female Monster page with various selections.

interactives.name: Conventional Attributes
interactives.description: The UNLV College of Gender Studies and Sexuality wanted to create an application that explore gender and attributes associated with a personâ€™s gender. I created an application that allows students to choose from randomly selected traits that visually shows them information about gender stereotypes. The graph at the end shows students masculine and feminine traits. It also breaks down the information individually to allow for course discussion.

wips.name: Customized Planner
wips.description: This is a custom planner that will be a way for professors the generate their own planners. It is made with angular 2.

wips.name: 3D Topographical Map
wips.description: This is an experimental project that I did for UNLV Online Ed. It is a 3d map for a geology class. It uses BabylonJS.

graphics.name: Port of Subs Brand Communication
graphics.description: Port of Subs is a sandwich company that created healthy food. I developed an entirely new branding system to support the Port of Subs image. View the branding communication guidelines for more information on my research and development of the design and branding.
